description: 'A NodeJS development environment.'
---

import { EnvOverview } from '@teambit/envs.docs.env-overview-template';

:::note
This node environments uses ESM by default, for CJS NodeJS environment, head to the [teambit.node/node-env](https://bit.cloud/teambit/node/node-env) environment
:::

A reusable development environment for NodeJS.  
Use the NodeJS environment to create new NodeJS modules, entities, apps and services.

Features:
- ▶️ TypeScript
- 🧪 Mocha.
- 🧑‍💻 Generator templates include [NodeJS Module](/), [Entity](/), [Express App](/), [Platform app](/) and a [native Bit app](/).
- 🚀 Workspace starter
- 🦋 ESLint
- ⚒️ A NodeJS optimized build pipeline.
- 👓 React-based Preview

## Use in existing workspaces

Add the development env to your generator configuration on `workspace.jsonc`.

```json
{
  "teambit.generator/generator": {
    "envs": [
      "bitdev.node/node-env"
    ]
  }
}
```

You can see the generator templates in your workspace using `bit templates`.

## Use on an existing component

Use this dev environment on your existing components, by running the following command: 

```
bit env set my-component bitdev.node/node-env
```


## Create a NodeJS workspace

You can create a new React workspace made from this env using the following command:

```
bit new node my-workspace --aspect bitdev.node/node-env
```

## Compose your own env

You can base on this env, and customize it to your needs. To create your env run this command:
```
bit create node-env my-node-env
```

Make sure your new environment class extends this env class and overrides the needed class methods.
